TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by Ms B. Zarić , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were initially represented by their former Agent , PERSON , and subsequently by their current Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted private prosecution proceedings against ORG , claiming that he had falsely accused her of extortion and nuisance in a letter to some local authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to submit some additional information , which she did on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the criminal court to speed up the proceedings in view of the short limitation period in respect of defamation claims ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal court responded that the proceedings would become statute - barred in DATE and that it would take all necessary measures to prevent that .

CARDINAL . On DATE a hearing to attempt a friendly settlement was held . The defendant expressed his readiness to make an apology to the applicant , since he had had no intention of insulting her . The applicant did not accept his apology .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the defendant guilty of defamation . However , ORG quashed that judgment and remitted the case for a retrial on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as statute - barred . ORG upheld that decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the present case , although the alleged defamation had taken place in DATE , the domestic courts applied LAW because its provisions were more lenient for the defendant in respect of punishment . LAW provides that the time - limit for criminal prosecution for defamation expires DATE after the commission of the offence .
CARDINAL . NORP Since DATE defamation has no longer been considered as a criminal offence ( OG RS no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , taken together , provide , inter alia , that anyone who has suffered fear , physical pain or mental anguish as a consequence of a breach of his reputation , personal integrity , liberty or of his other personal rights ( prava ličnosti ) is entitled to seek injunctive relief , sue for financial compensation and request other forms of redress “ which might be capable ” of affording adequate non - pecuniary satisfaction .
